title: Authors and Citation
text: Reilly J, Mechtanberg H, Peelle J, Myers E (2025). SemanticDistance: Computes Pairwise Cosine Distance Successive Units Language Samples. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/Reilly-ConceptsCognitionLab/SemanticDistance.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SemanticDistance: Computes Pairwise Cosine Distance Between Successive Units of Language Samples},   author = {Jamie Reilly and Hannah Mechtanberg and Jonathan Peelle and Emily Myers},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/Reilly-ConceptsCognitionLab/SemanticDistance}, }

what: Computes Pairwise Cosine Distance Between Successive Units of Language Samples
title: Computes Pairwise Cosine Distance Between Successive Units of Language Samples
text: SemanticDistance cleans formats text computes pairwise metrics cosine semantic distance different adjacent chunks (e.g., ngrams, words, turns) within language samples. offer two different semantic distance metrics, experiential embedding. Experiential semantic distance reflects cosine (normalized 0) two vectors spanning 15 meaningful semantic dimensions (e.g., color, sound, valence). Embedding-based semantic distances derived contrasting word’s corresponding semantic vector spanning 300 hyperparameters trained GLOVE word embedding model. SemamticDistance package contains lookup databases semantic vectors spanning >70k English words. SemanticDistance operates dataframe nominally one column text split one word-per-row format. However, SemanticDistance can also produce distance values words arrayed two columns. Users numerous ‘chunking’ options rolling distance comparisons either monologues (speaker information) dialogues (speakers identifed conversation transcripts). Chunk options include:  1) word--word  2) ngram--ngram  3) ngram--word (rolling)  4) turn--turn (split talker ID)

title: Computes Pairwise Cosine Distance Between Successive Units of Language Samples
text: can install development version SemanticDistance GitHub : nominally need one column text within dataframe. text pre-formatted split one word per row format. However, SemanticDistance also capable computing pairwise cosine distance across two columns (e.g., dog leash).

title: Computes Pairwise Cosine Distance Between Successive Units of Language Samples
text: Pre-format language transcript. SemanticDistance works monologues (talker information) dialogues (two speakers). First load package. read transcript R. doesn’t matter label variables. specify names arguments function calls. first critical step clean format transcript. three cleaning functions choose based structure data: clean_monologue, clean_dialogue, clean_columns

title: clean_dialogue — clean_dialogue
text: Cleans transcript two talkers. User specifies dataframe column name target text stored arguments function. Default option lemmatize strings. Function splits unlists text output one-row-per-word format marked unique numeric identifier (.e., 'id_orig')
